strategy: Introduce a LightGBM model trained on engineered features that capture socio-economic gradients (e.g., fare bins, family size, age group) and map them to survival probabilities using gradient boosting on aggregated boarding group statistics. Instead of relying on sequential or relational data, this approach focuses on discrete, categorical patterns in passenger demographics and socioeconomic status, hypothesizing that class-based access to lifeboats and group behavior are strong predictors independent of boarding order. Features are derived from fare, age, and cabin deck, and grouped into socioeconomic strata with survival rates computed per stratum.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from lightgbm import LGBMClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering: create interaction features
train_df['Sex'] = train_df['Sex'].map({'male': 0, 'female': 1})
test_df['Sex'] = test_df['Sex'].map({'male': 0, 'female': 1})

# Create interaction features based on class and gender
train_df['female_first_class'] = (train_df['Sex'] == 1) & (train_df['Pclass'] == 1)
train_df['male_third_class'] = (train_df['Sex'] == 0) & (train_df['Pclass'] == 3)
train_df['female_third_class'] = (train_df['Sex'] == 1) & (train_df['Pclass'] == 3)
train_df['male_first_class'] = (train_df['Sex'] == 0) & (train_df['Pclass'] == 1)

test_df['female_first_class'] = (test_df['Sex'] == 1) & (test_df['Pclass'] == 1)
test_df['male_third_class'] = (test_df['Sex'] == 0) & (test_df['Pclass'] == 3)
test_df['female_third_class'] = (test_df['Sex'] == 1) & (test_df['Pclass'] == 3)
test_df['male_first_class'] = (test_df['Sex'] == 0) & (test_df['Pclass'] == 1)

# Handle missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Create age groups
train_df['Age_Group'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=[0, 12, 18, 35, 60, 100], labels=[0, 1, 2, 3, 4])
test_df['Age_Group'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=[0, 12, 18, 35, 60, 100], labels=[0, 1, 2, 3, 4])

# Create fare bins
train_df['Fare_Bin'] = pd.cut(train_df['Fare'], bins=5, labels=False)
test_df['Fare_Bin'] = pd.cut(test_df['Fare'], bins=5, labels=False)

# Extract cabin deck (first letter)
train_df['Cabin_Deck'] = train_df['Cabin'].str[0].fillna('Unknown')
test_df['Cabin_Deck'] = test_df['

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
